ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: then each self will know what it has done.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Then) every soul will know what it had prepared (for itself).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: then shall each person know what he has brought along.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: then every soul will discover the consequence of its deeds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Every soul will then come know what it has brought.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Every person will know what he has brought.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Every soul shall (then) know what it has prepared.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: then shall a soul know what it has produced.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Then) every soul will know what it hath made ready.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [then] each soul shall know what it has put forward.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Then every soul shall know that which it: hath presented.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: then a soul shall know what it has readied [for itself].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (Then) shall each soul know what it has put forward.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: (Then) every person will know what he has brought (of good and evil).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: then, each soul shall know what it has produced.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Each soul will know what it has readied.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [81:14] [then] a soul, every soul, at the time of the [occurrence of the] things mentioned, which is the Day of Resurrection, will know what it has presented, of good or evil.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((Then) every soul will know) every soul whether it is righteous or sinful will know at that point (what it hath made ready) what it has sent forth of good or evil.
